item.description: Rasterization # It is a process to make a correct vector to raster conversion in an image form sense. Vectorial images consist of several lines, paths and shapes in a 2D or 3D environment that are defined mathematically to describe objects and scenes. A raster image uses a bitmap or set of pixels in the form of a grid or matrix to represent an image. Rasterization is important because pixel format is the format used in digital output image devices.
